title: What is the theme of Imagine by John Lennon? - Quora

response.answer_text: It's about an imaginary “utopian” world where there are no wars, no religions and no need for money. A perfect world where everyone gets along. Obviously a world like that will very likely and very sadly never exist, that's why the song is called “Imagine” and he sings about being a “dreamer”.

Y’all kinda right. But bruhhhhh, I think the song is more likely to be promoting peace and pacifism. The rise of terrorist attacks, human trafficking, and international conflicts in the 21st century reveals the intensification of the intricacy of power dynamics on an international level. John Lennon, A.K.A the “Father of Peace”, was also a pacifist. In 1967, Lennon started to espouse pacifism in his lyrics; some of them even being adopted as anthems for the anti-war movement. Later on, he held a two-week-long “Bed-Ins for Peace” as an anti-war campaign for the Vietnam War. “Imagine” was written in 1971, at the climax of Lennon’s Peace Movement. Not only did he continue his Bed-Ins Peace campaign in different places, but he also released singles, which are associated with anti-militarism and world peace, notably “Happy Xmas (War is Over).” In the lyrics, components of pacifism appear in a grandiose and utopian way. “Imagine there are no countries” and “Nothing to kill or die for” lead fans to fantasize an anarchic world without countries ad pains. It also reveals a realist perspective on the causation of “wars”. Realists argue that the countries are individual actors on a global scale; and are struggling for survival and self-interest. Thus, states are destined to start wars. In the case, “countries” can also be an analogy of human greediness on a local level. “Imagine all the people living life in peace,” and “imagine all the people. Sharing all the world,” also create a harmonious, idealistic picture for listeners. However, this illusory utopia creates an immense contrast to reality. The brutalities, violence, wars, and injustices are then magnified. The chasm between the utopia in “Imagine” and reality has proven that “peace” is the only way out to combat brutality while “fighting fire with fire” can never be considered as a measure. Growing up, I’ve always been a big fan of the Lennon gang (shout out to the Beatles xoxo)! His one-of-a-kind thoughts on pacifism, his flamboyant ideal on spreading peace dragged me from being a pessimist to an optimist. “You may say I’m a dreamer,” but if everybody DOES value peace and eliminate any use of violence?, A peaceful utopia would no longer be just an idea, but a reality!. I know something is happening in my hometown, Hong Kong, at the moment. But PLEASE DON’T USE ANY FORM OF VIOLENCE NO MATTER WHAT!
